intro: Lagarinthus abyssinicus, commonly known as the Abyssinian lantana, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or blue in color, arranged in dense inflorescences. It thrives in sunny, well-drained environments and is often found in rocky or arid regions. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
